text: That is indeed helpful and of course whenever you have time to look at the CV it's fine. I'm wondering because the Universities are so expensive, do you think doing an apprenticeship after the A-Level would be more helpful?  And than go to the University? Or will it be too hard to come back to the higher education? Because what I've heard is that people who are taking break and start to work after the A-Levels or College they struggle more when they go to the University after lets say 4 years because educations and curriculum changes every year and goes higher and higher.

I haven't really heard of people completing an apprenticeship and then going to university. I think most people (that I know of at least) do one or the other but not both as a lot of apprenticeships these days come with a qualification that is the equivalent of a university degree. They require you study and pass exams in the same way, albeit probably in a different format
Why do you think you might like to do both an apprenticeship and then a university degree?
Are many of your friends/peers considering this?
I just thought that Apprenticeship is next level education and than University was the final one. I didn't know that completeing apprenticeship degree is equivalent to university degree.

But what is the difference than in Apprenticeship or University if they both give you equivalent qualification? If there where two poeple and one with Apprienticeship degree and University degree who would they choose and why?
